title: Perceived Stress Scale
introduction: The Perceived Stress Scale is a validated tool for measuring the degree to which situations in one's life are appraised as stressful.
purpose: This scale helps identify stress levels and can guide stress management strategies, but it cannot replace professional consultation.
instructions: In the last month, how often have you felt or thought a certain way?
disclaimer: This assessment helps identify stress levels but does not replace professional consultation.

stress-1.text: How often have you been upset because of something that happened unexpectedly?

stress-2.text: How often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?

stress-3.text: How often have you felt nervous and 'stressed'?

stress-4.text: How often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?

stress-5.text: How often have you felt that things were going your way?

stress-6.text: How often have you found that you could not cope with all the things that you had to do?

stress-7.text: How often have you been able to control irritations in your life?

stress-8.text: How often have you felt that you were on top of things?

stress-9.text: How often have you been angered because of things that were outside of your control?

stress-10.text: How often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?

total_score.name: Perceived Stress Scale Total Score
total_score.description: Sum of all item scores (reverse scoring for items 4, 5, 7, 8)

2.label: High Stress
recommendations: Seek professional help for stress management

low.interpretation: Your score indicates low perceived stress levels.
low.recommendations: Continue maintaining your current stress management strategies and healthy lifestyle habits.
low.supportResources: Consider learning additional stress management techniques for future use.

moderate.interpretation: Your score indicates moderate perceived stress levels.
moderate.recommendations: Consider implementing stress management techniques such as relaxation exercises, time management, and maintaining work-life balance.
moderate.supportResources: Consider stress management workshops, mindfulness apps, or support groups.

high.interpretation: Your score indicates high perceived stress levels.
high.recommendations: We recommend seeking professional help for stress management, including counseling or therapy to develop comprehensive stress reduction strategies.
high.supportResources: Please consider contacting a mental health professional who can help you develop effective stress management strategies.
